Two players, Player A and Player B, are playing a game. Each player chooses between two options, Option 1 or Option 2. If both players choose Option 1, Player A wins and receives $5, while Player B receives nothing. If both players choose Option 2, Player B wins and receives $5, while Player A receives nothing. If the players choose different options, neither player wins any money. If Player A's payoff matrix is

$\begin{pmatrix}5 & 0\\0 & 0\end{pmatrix}$

and Player B's payoff matrix is 

$\begin{pmatrix}0 & 0\\5 & 0\end{pmatrix}$

What is the optimal strategy for each player?

Since both players will always choose their respective options (Option 1 for Player A and Option 2 for Player B) regardless of the other player's strategy, there is no Nash equilibrium in pure strategies. However, there can be a Nash equilibrium in mixed strategies.
